binary search.concept: Binary search is a divide-and-conquer algorithm used on sorted arrays.

explanations.beginner: Binary search works only on sorted lists. You check the middle element, then choose the left or right half.
explanations.intermediate: Binary search halves the search range at each step, giving O(log n) time complexity.
explanations.advanced: Binary search relies on loop invariants and careful mid calculation to avoid overflow. Runs in O(log n).
